instruction: What metric was chosen to assess the crop health status of barley and oat crop fields in Prince Edward Island and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen in the related study is the green area index (GAI) and vegetation indices (VIs). The GAI was used to assess the crop health status of barley and oat crop fields in Prince Edward Island, Canada. The VIs were used in machine learning pipelines with regression algorithms to predict the GAI. 

The GAI metric measures the amount of green vegetation in a given area and is commonly used to evaluate crop health and vigor. It provides information about the density and health of the vegetation, which can be indicative of crop stress or vitality. 

In this study, the GAI metric was used to create maps of the crop fields and assess the health status of the crops. The regression algorithms were then used to predict the GAI values based on the VIs. The random forests algorithm was found to be the best algorithm for GAI prediction, with an average relative root mean square error of 10.86% and a mean absolute error of 0.67.

The GAI metric, along with the regression algorithms, allowed for the classification of the crop areas into vigorous and stressed categories. The resulting GAI maps and the regression feature space were classified using random forests, achieving a mean overall accuracy of 94%.

instruction: How were the machine learning pipelines utilized in assessing the crop health status of barley and oat crop fields in Prince Edward Island, Canada using unmanned aircraft system (UAS) mapping and vegetation indices (VIs)?
